name: incorruptibly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that suggests someone is morally strong enough not to be persuaded to do something wrong: He was an incorruptibly principled defender of self-government.
formal in a way that will not decay or be destroyed: Customer information is securely and incorruptibly protected. See
incorruptible
More examplesFewer examplesShe was the child of incorruptibly socialist parents.an incorruptibly virtuous official The hope is that contracts can be made and enforced without any human intervention, instantaneously and incorruptibly.We had one ritual that was incorruptibly consistent.
